resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.

fields.summary: Not able to login to Eucalyptus User Console

status.name: Closed

fields.description:
[Installed|http://www.eucalyptus.com/docs/eucalyptus/3.3/console-guide/console_install_intro.html#console_install_intro] and [configured|http://www.eucalyptus.com/docs/eucalyptus/3.3/console-guide/console_configure_intro.html#console_configure_intro] up the Eucalyptus 3.3 User Console per the documentation.  It takes anywhere between ~20 to ~30+ seconds to load the console login page (if the page isn't cached).   

*Browser Information*

Tested with the following browsers:

* Apple Safari Version 6.1 (8537.43.58)
* Google Chrome Version 27.0.1453.116

*Information regarding Server Running User Console*

The machine information where the  User Console is running is as follows:

_User Console Configuration File_

[server]

pollfreq=20

[test]

[loggers]

[handlers]
keys=eucahandler

[formatters]
keys=eucaformat

[logger_root]
level=INFO
handlers=eucahandler

[handler_eucahandler]
class=StreamHandler
level=NOTSET
formatter=eucaformat
args=(sys.stdout,)

[formatter_eucaformat]
format=%(asctime)-15s %(levelname)s %(message)s
datefmt=%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S



[paths]
staticpath: /usr/share/eucalyptus-console/static
{code}
fields.summary: Performance Issues with Eucalyptus User Console
fields.environment: User Console on separate machine from any Eucalyptus component

comments.body:
Added display from Developer Console from Apple Safari recording how long it took for the page to load.  In addition, added the errors recorded by the Developer Console.   The errors are as follows:

{code}
[Error] Failed to load resource: the server responded with a status of 404 (Not Found)
	send ([native code], line 0)
	send (jquery-1.8.2.js, line 8416)
	ajax (jquery-1.8.2.js, line 7968)
	loadHtml (help.js, line 82)
	load (help.js, line 102)
	load (help.js, line 58)
	help (help.js, line 26)
	success (eucalyptus.js, line 44)
	fire (jquery-1.8.2.js, line 974)
	fireWith (jquery-1.8.2.js, line 1082)
	done (jquery-1.8.2.js, line 7788)
	callback (jquery-1.8.2.js, line 8500)
[Error] Error: Load timeout for modules: underscore,backbone,backbone-validation
http://requirejs.org/docs/errors.html#timeout
	onError (require.js, line 1765)
	onError (require.js, line 521)
	checkLoaded (require.js, line 669)
	(anonymous function) (require.js, line 688)
{code}

Added sosreport which has logs from the User Console.  Please let me know if any additional information is needed.

Able to reproduce.  Took around 24 seconds. Steps to reproduce are as follows:

*  Start up Apple Safari Version 6.1
*  Put in URL for Eucalyptus User Console
{code}
https://10.104.10.6:8888
{code}
*  Monitor how long it takes for page to load.

_Note: for information on how to leverage the Developer Console in Apple Safari 6, please reference the [Safari Developer Tools Guide|http://developer.apple.com/library/safari/#documentation/AppleApplications/Conceptual/Safari_Developer_Guide/2SafariDeveloperTools/SafariDeveloperTools.html]._

Attached sosreport from running confirmation test.  Also included screen shots of the following:

* HTML file that reported 404 error on loading
* Errors reported back from Developer Console.  The errors are as follows:
{code}
[Error] Failed to load resource: the server responded with a status of 404 (Not Found)
	send ([native code], line 0)
	send (jquery-1.8.2.js, line 8416)
	ajax (jquery-1.8.2.js, line 7968)
	loadHtml (help.js, line 82)
	load (help.js, line 102)
	load (help.js, line 58)
	help (help.js, line 26)
	success (eucalyptus.js, line 44)
	fire (jquery-1.8.2.js, line 974)
	fireWith (jquery-1.8.2.js, line 1082)
	done (jquery-1.8.2.js, line 7788)
	callback (jquery-1.8.2.js, line 8500)

[Error] Error: Load timeout for modules: underscore,backbone,backbone-validation
http://requirejs.org/docs/errors.html#timeout
	onError (require.js, line 1765)
	onError (require.js, line 521)
	checkLoaded (require.js, line 669)
	(anonymous function) (require.js, line 688)

[Error] Failed to load resource: the server responded with a status of 404 (Not Found)
	send ([native code], line 0)
	send (jquery-1.8.2.js, line 8416)
	ajax (jquery-1.8.2.js, line 7968)
	loadHtml (help.js, line 82)
	load (help.js, line 102)
	load (help.js, line 58)
	help (help.js, line 26)
	success (eucalyptus.js, line 44)
	fire (jquery-1.8.2.js, line 974)
	fireWith (jquery-1.8.2.js, line 1082)
	done (jquery-1.8.2.js, line 7788)
	callback (jquery-1.8.2.js, line 8500)

[Error] Error: Load timeout for modules: backbone,backbone-validation
http://requirejs.org/docs/errors.html#timeout
	onError (require.js, line 1765)
	onError (require.js, line 521)
	checkLoaded (require.js, line 669)
	(anonymous function) (require.js, line 688)
{code}

The console load all help pages up front, and we know that's a problem which we intend to fix in 4.0. That is the primary reason for it taking quite some time for the login page to appear. Even when those are cached, the request is still made with a 304 response.
Many of the performance issues were covered, except as [~dkavanagh] notes below on help preloading.  That will be covered in 4.0

I've attached a screenshot (loading_slow.png).  The issue I tend to see is that the banner loads fairly quickly but the main body of the page can take up to 10 seconds to load (and thus be able to login)
From my perspective it seems like a user experience issue.  Some kind of loading screen/bar would be good. cc'ing [~jloza]
Confirmed from both Chrome and Firefox on Windows 8 + Linux and across multiple instances of the User Console, on different connections and in different environments.

Yes, we should add a loading indicator to the login screen. That is something much easier than fixing the help load, which is the root of the problem [~dkavanagh] thinks. We could probably add that for 3.4 if it will help you and [~tjcramer] blesses that? That would require a separate bug so we don't lose track of the root cause fix for 4.0.
Agreed, I think performance is a long term thing but a short term fix like that would really help the user experience.  I think that might help [~eucacolby].

Yes a load screen or anything that tells the user that something is happening is better than the blank screen today

- Colby
m: 617.615.6528
Took 11.2 seconds to fully load login page from my house. We definitely need a loading indicator here.
[~hspencer] should be resolved in 4.0.0, please reopen if not the case
